text: Buddha's Birthday paper lanterns at Pagyesa Pagyesa roof edge Pagyesa, or Pagye Temple, is a Buddhist temple in Palgongsan mountain park, near Daegu, South Korea. The temple was first built in 804 by a priest named Simji, and was restored and expanded in the 17th century. ==References== Category:Buddhist temples in South Korea Category:Korean culture
title: Pagyesa
